sentences: Haavatu vaakus öö otsa hinge ja suri alles hommikul.
Küünlad kuusel vaakusid hinge .. E. Rängel.
context: The word 'suremas' is the elative case of 'surema' (to die), meaning 'in the process of dying' or 'while dying'. It can also mean perishing, fading away, or disappearing. In context 1, it refers to someone who was hovering between life and death all night before finally dying in the morning. In context 2, it describes Russian autocracy that was fading away/perishing. In context 3, candles on a fir tree are said to be perishing/fading.
